Package org.bremersee.spring.security.authentication

Class AuthenticationConverter<S,T extends org.springframework.security.core.Authentication>

java.lang.Object
org.bremersee.spring.security.authentication.AuthenticationConverter<S,T>
Type Parameters:
S - the type of the authentication source
T - the type of the normalized authentication
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.core.convert.converter.Converter<S,T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
JsonPathJwtConverter, LdaptiveAuthenticationTokenConverter
public abstract class AuthenticationConverter<S,T extends org.springframework.security.core.Authentication> extends Object implements org.springframework.core.convert.converter.Converter<S,T>
The normalized authentication converter supports normalization of roles.

The order of normalization is:

  • 1. default roles are always added as they are defined (no normalization is done)
  • 2. role mapping (if role is mapped, further steps will be skipped)
  • 3. case transformation ('java-developers' -> 'JAVA-DEVELOPERS')
  • 4. string replacements (replace '-DEVELOPERS' with _DEVELOPER' -> 'JAVA_DEVELOPER')
  • 5. adding prefix, if role does not start with prefix (prefix is 'ROLE_' -> 'ROLE_JAVA_DEVELOPER')
Author:
Christian Bremer
